JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and Mr ORG , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in LOC . They were represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The first applicant , a singer in GPE , was taken into custody and allegedly subjected to ill - treatment on several occasions for being a female singer , which is forbidden in GPE on religious grounds . On CARDINAL of those occasions the second applicant , who is her husband , was involved in a fight with a police officer in GPE . The applicants fled GPE and entered GPE on DATE .

On arrival in GPE they applied for asylum before the national authorities and requested from the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( “ the ORG ” ) in GPE recognition as refugees . The second applicant was registered as a dependant of the first applicant . The national authorities granted the applicants permission to reside in LOC pending asylum proceedings .
On DATE the ORG rejected the first applicant ’s refugee claim .
On DATE the applicants participated in a protest in front of ORG in GPE against the NORP regime .

On DATE the national authorities notified the applicants that their asylum claims had been rejected and that they had DATE to object to this decision . The applicants filed their objection on DATE . They were subsequently permitted to reside in PERSON pending examination of their objection .
Sometime in DATE the second applicant requested permission to settle in PERSON . The applicant ’s request was granted and the couple were issued with temporary residence permits .
Following new developments in her case , the first applicant ’s file before the ORG was re - opened on DATE . The NORP authorities were informed of the situation on QUANTITY DATE and DATE .

On DATE a second deportation order was issued in respect of the applicants , which requested the applicants to leave GPE by DATE , at the end of the applicants’ children ’s school term . The applicants subsequently informed the NORP authorities of the reopening of their file before the ORG and twice requested a stay of the execution of the deportation order . According to the information in the case file the applicants’ residence permit was extended until DATE .
Having examined the first applicant ’s refugee claim after the re - opening of the file , the ORG rejected it again on DATE .

On DATE the second applicant informed the ORG that he went back to GPE in DATE to attend his father ’s funeral . He claimed that he was arrested at the NORP border and tortured in detention in GPE for DATE before he was released on bail . He had then fled back to GPE in DATE .
On DATE the President of the ORG to which the case was allocated decided to indicate to the Government , under LAW , that the applicants should not be deported to GPE until further notice .
On DATE the Government informed the applicants that execution of the deportation order in respect of the applicants had been stayed in compliance with the ORG ’s interim measure .
